revised_title: Precise Measurements of Mercury Density at 20°C: Absolute Displacement Method
tldr: This study presents precise measurements of the density of mercury at 20°C using the absolute displacement method. The research team, led by A. H. Cook and N. W. B. Stone, aimed to improve the accuracy of the temperature scale by determining the boiling point of water under a specified pressure. They used a mercury barometer to measure pressure and a pycnometer to determine the volume of mercury. The results provide a more accurate understanding of mercury density and contribute to the improvement of the temperature scale.
